definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: He also had a couple of revolvers with which to defend himself .
sentences.chinese: 他也備有幾把左輪手槍用以防身。

sentences.english: Mom said that this is my self-defense weapons, the use of a lot.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽說，這是我的防身武器，用處很多。

sentences.english: When I was about 14, a woman came to our school to talk about self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 在我大概十四歲時，一位女士來我們學校講授防身術。

sentences.english: She's learning self-defense so she can protect herself from being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 她正在學習自我防身術，以使自己免受攻擊。

sentences.english: The weapons must be defensive and training provided.
sentences.chinese: 武器必須能防身，並經過訓練。

sentences.english: The Pangolin uses its scales as protection when it roles into a ball to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 當縮成球狀睡覺時，穿山甲將其鱗皮作爲防身之物。

sentences.english: After the thirdwoman was killed in Savannah, he insisted I keep it.
sentences.chinese: 薩凡納第三個女孩被殺後，他堅持要我拿着防身。

sentences.english: Women have to learn some defense.

definition: to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
empty-handed/unarmed/(painting, embroidery etc) without following a model/(abbr. for 空手道[kong1 shou3 dao4]) karate
a possible period of want or need
Buddha's teaching/Buddhist monk's apparel, staff etc/(Daoism) magic weapon/talisman/fig. specially effective device/magic wand
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
